content.question:
A week before a state election, a random sample of voters from City J and a random sample of voters from City K were taken. Of the 100 voters selected from City J, 65 indicated they were supporting a certain candidate for state senate. Of the 125 voters selected from City K, 75 indicated they were supporting the candidate.
Which of the following is the correct test statistic for a two-sample <math alttext="z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test for a difference in population proportions for the two cities (J minus K) in their support for the candidate?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator 0.65 minus 0.60 and denominator, the square root of 0.65 times 0.6 times, open parenthesis, the fraction 1 over 100 plus the fraction 1 over 125, close parenthesis, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.65</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0.60</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.65</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>0.6</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>125</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 0.65 minus 0.60 and denominator, the square root of 0.62 times 0.38 times, open parenthesis, the fraction 1 over 100 plus the fraction 1 over 125, close parenthesis, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.65</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0.60</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.62</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>0.38</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>125</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 0.65 minus 0.60 and denominator, the square root of 0.62 times 0.38 times, open parenthesis, the fraction 1 over 100 plus 125, close parenthesis, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.65</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0.60</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.62</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>0.38</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>100</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>125</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 65 minus 75 and denominator, the square root of 0.65 times 0.60 times, open parenthesis, the fraction 1 over 100 plus the fraction 1 over 125, close parenthesis, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>65</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>75</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.65</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>0.60</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>125</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 65 minus 75 and denominator, the square root of the fraction 0.62 over 100 plus the fraction 0.38 over 125, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>65</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>75</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.62</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.38</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>125</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator 0.65 minus 0.60 and denominator, the square root of 0.62 times 0.38 times, open parenthesis, the fraction 1 over 100 plus the fraction 1 over 125, close parenthesis, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.65</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0.60</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.62</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>0.38</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>125</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 6.11: Carrying Out a Test for the Difference of Two Population Proportions

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Calculate a test statistic and find a p-value, provided conditions for inference are met.
